intro: Spigelia megapotamica, commonly known as the Brazilian candlewood, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange in color. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, which can be harmful to humans and animals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests and along riverbanks. Its unique floral structure and medicinal properties have made it a subject of interest in both horticulture and pharmacological research.
